title: getPlayers query
custom_steps: WHEN I make a request to midfield with a player id 605141 (Mookie Betts)
custom_expected:
THEN I should get a valid response
AND I should see Mookie Betts' walk-up music detail

title: GetTeamWalkupMusic query
custom_expected: THEN I should get player walk up music back for LA Dodgers

title: Each player will display at most 3 songs on the UI
Each player with at least one song in the FiveTool will show up on the teams walk-up music page
Walk-up music table rows: Player, Song/Artist, Album
For song/artist, there will be an album image, song title & artist name
Album col will contain the name of the album the music is from
Each player will have a headshot in the "Player" column
Clicking on the song title will open the spotify song page
Clicking on the player image will open the player stats page on the same window
Analytics on Player card search result
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on mlb page
AND I am search for Aaron Judge
AND I click on Aaron Judge suggestion
custom_steps:
WHEN I click on Aaron Judge's walk up music from the right side of the search result page
AND I am filtering Network calls with "ss/"
custom_expected:
THEN I should see a tracking event fired
AND I should see the following values:
c3 = player id
c12 = Music
c13 = page name
c14 = site search: results: wlk up music: song title click
v140 = text of the song title clicked
v141 = target url of song link clicked

title: Analytics on walk-up music page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on walk-up music page for Yankees
AND Aaron Judge is listed on the page 
AND Aaron Judge has a walk-up song selected
custom_steps: WHEN I click on the walk-up song for Aaron Judge
custom_expected:
THEN I should see a tracking event fired
AND I should see the following values:
c3 = player id
c12 = Music
c13 = page name
c14 = site search: results: wlk up music: song title click
v140 = text of the song title clicked
v141 = target url of song link clicked

title: On search page, player's Walk-up music song title and artist will be grouped together
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on the MLB search page
AND I search for Aaron Judge
AND Aaron Judge has a linkable music on his page
AND I have a11y mode turned on my device
custom_steps:
WHEN I move my focus to Aaron Judge's music with a11y assistance
AND I move focus to first music
custom_expected: THEN the device should be announcing the music title and artist name

title: On search page, player's Walk-up music song title and artist will not be announced if the song if marked to be do not link in 5ive tool
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on the MLB search page
AND I search for Shohei Ohtani
AND Shohei Ohtani has only 1 song 
AND the song is un-linkable music on the search page section {change the song setting in 5ive tool if needed)
AND I have a11y mode turned on my device
custom_steps: WHEN I move my focus to Shohei Ohtani's music with a11y assistance
custom_expected: THEN the device should NOT be focusing on the song section

title: On search page, a11y focus will not move to  player's Walk-up music song title and artist that have  "do not link" enabled  in 5ive tool but the focus should move to the next ones
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on the MLB search page
AND I know Juan Soto has multiple songs (at least 3 songs) set up for his walk-up music list
AND I know it's the 2nd song which is "do not link" enabled
AND I search for Juan Soto
AND I have a11y mode turned on my device
custom_steps: WHEN I move my focus to Juan Soto's music with a11y assistance
custom_expected:
THEN the tool will focus on the 1st song 
AND the tool should announce the song title and artist name

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the focus is attempted to move to the next song
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the focus will NOT move to the 2nd song
BUT the focus will move to the 3rd song.

title: On team's walk up music page, a11y focus will land on player's linked music
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on Yankees' player walk-up music page `/yankees/ballpark/music`
AND I have a11y feature turned on
custom_steps: WHEN I move focus to a player's music
custom_expected:
THEN the tool should move its focus to that song
AND it should announce the appropriate text associated with it

title: On team's walk up music page, a11y focus will not land on player's unlinked music
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on Yankees' player walk-up music page /yankees/ballpark/music
AND I have a11y feature turned on
AND I have a player with a song unlinked in 5ive tool
custom_steps: WHEN I move focus to that player's music
custom_expected:
THEN the tool should NOT move its focus to that song
AND it should NOT announce the appropriate text associated with it
